title: ETZ Swap + CypherGoat: What This Partnership Actually Changes for You
keyQuestions: How does a swap comparison layer work?
What does the ETZ Swap partnership change for users?
Does using a route comparison tool guarantee no KYC?
What should I do if a swap is delayed or fails?
quickSteps: Choose your priority (rate, speed, or lower identity friction) before comparing routes.
Compare routes in one place to reduce tab-hopping and avoid rushed decisions.
Pick a provider with clear expectations and don’t ignore route warnings.
Confirm network, address, and memo/tag requirements before you send funds.
If something goes wrong, share only public swap details and follow official support paths.
riskNotes: Route comparison improves decision context but does not eliminate transaction risk.
A lower likelihood of verification is not a guarantee; edge cases can trigger extra checks depending on provider policies.
Most user losses happen from wrong links, wrong networks, or rushed decisions—use bookmarks and confirm details before sending.
Never share a seed phrase or allow remote access, even if someone claims to be support.
